item.title: City Maps
item.description:
A script I wrote to generate artistic city maps from OpenStreeMap. The script downloads the data to disk and reloads it to memory, to finally create the plot. The script automatically adjusts (roughly, according to the 1Â° lat = 111,111m rule) the coordinates to your aspect ratio in order to avoid distortions of the map. I did not manage to remove the white space on the top and right side of the plot. In addition, the code developed from a specific city to general, so there are many inherited inconveniences, especially in terms of size scaling.

Download the script here

item.title: City Maps
item.description:
As preparation to approach the housing market of munich, I wanted to create a map showing the duration it would take to commute via public transport for both my partner and I. For mapping, my city maps code was used, overlaid by a heatmap. The data was queried for points on a grid and linearly interpolated to reduce the number of API queries. For this specific version, the map displays the maximum time to either of two stations and is capped of at 60 minutes.

APIs used, please be kind:

  • MVG-API (undocumented, munich public transport data, some hints can be found here)
  • OSM-API

The Code can be found here: Github Repo
